title: Jesus as Master of the Matter-verse and the Story-verse and Brings them Together in Himself
description:
Over the last three weeks we've been seeing Jesus in a leadership light. Three weeks ago we asked about the secret of his success and we saw how he gave authority to his hapless disciples to cast out unclean spirits. This is deeply problematic for many secularists to understand but it is a highly symbolic, world-changing and powerful move that everyone in his day understood. Herod Antipas, in fact, understood it through his guilty terror over killing John the Baptist. This week the focus swings back to Jesus where he feeds 5000 men with five loaves and two fish. What does that story mean in this context? What point is the gospel writer trying to make that makes sense to us today? 

Click here to meetup with other channel viewers for conversation https://discord.gg/2uUhZBK The link will prompt you to download the software for this free group messaging service. This link updates every 100 users so look for the most recent videos if this link doesn't work.

If you want to schedule a one-on-one conversation check here. https://paulvanderklay.me/2019/08/06/converzations-with-pvk/

For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/

To listen to this on ITunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/paul-vanderklays-podcast/id1394314333 

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/
